property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: The main hub area of the TV World. The [[party]] is transported here after each round of [[TV Time]].

property.name: page
property.value: Green Room

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] ends up here after escaping [[Tenna]]'s capture. From there, they make their way back to the [[Green Room]] while evading Tenna and his employees.

property.name: description
property.value: An unseen NPC transfers the [[party]] to a Wild West setting, where they must clear a round of the Cowboy Minigame to continue.

property.name: page
property.value: Cowboy Minigame

property.name: description
property.value: The Monster Movie set. The [[party]] can play this minigame in the [[Green Room]] after round 1 and round 2 of [[TV Time]].

property.name: page
property.value: Monster Movie

property.name: description
property.value: An unseen NPC transfers the [[party]] to a Wild West setting, where they must clear a round of the Cowboy Minigame to continue.

property.name: page
property.value: Cowboy Minigame

property.name: description
property.value: Kris can occupy this console and push the lawnmower, destroying the [[Shadowguy]]s' contracts and freeing them from their jobs. This action adds 20 [[recruits]] to the Shadowguy recruit count if no Shadowguys have been LOST.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Tenna]] is seen ordering his employees to return to work and capture the [[party]], despite their complaints that they do not want to fight. Tenna reminds them of their work contracts before leaving.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Tenna]] is seen calling [[Ramb]] about [[Toriel]]'s state. Ramb quits over the phone, and Tenna leaves in frustration.

property.name: description
property.value: The set for the Rock Video, which is played during the second round of [[TV Time]]. This set is repurposed into a "Darkners Live" concert with [[Shadowguy]]s playing if they have been fully [[Recruits|recruited]].

property.name: page
property.value: Rock Video

property.name: description
property.value: [[Tenna]] appears while the [[Pippins]] are raiding the treasure chests for [[POINT]]s. The Pippins then steal the items scattered throughout the room, despite Tenna's protests. Tenna mentions having a secret item before leaving.

property.name: description
property.value: Inside the wardrobe is a [[Pipis (Item)|Pipis]]. Before [[Kris]] can take it, however, [[Tenna]] arrives to find the Pipis outside the wardrobe. If the [[Dealmaker]] or [[Puppet Scarf]] are in the [[inventory]] on the normal route, [[Spamton]] temporarily leaves the inventory and appears before Tenna, who does not recognize him, after which Tenna takes the Pipis back. Otherwise, a crowd appears and gasps in shock, while Tenna attempts to defend himself. He leaves without the Pipis, allowing Kris to take it.

property.name: description
property.value: The set for the Cooking Show minigame, played during the first round of [[TV Time]]. Many [[Shadowguy]]s and [[Pippins]] are crowding behind the counter.

property.name: page
property.value: Cooking Show

property.name: description
property.value: [[Tenna]] desperately attempts to keep his employees as they begin to quit their jobs. He blames his failure on [[Spamton]], his former partner.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Lanino and Elnina]] quit their jobs in frot of [[Tenna]]. As Tenna mocks their decision, [[Mike]] announces his departure as well.

property.name: description
property.value: A Dust Pile. Can be destroyed when interacted with.

property.name: page
property.value: Dust Pile

properties.property:
The [[party]] is met with a pop quiz and must answer two questions to continue forward. Here, the questions are as follows:
WHAT'S THE REWARD FOR C-RANK? (Answer: [[Watercooler|COOLER]])
WHO RUNS THE [[Green Room|GREEN ROOM]] CONCESSIONS? (Answer: RAMB)

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#First Quiz Room

properties.property:
The [[party]] is met with a pop quiz and must answer two questions to continue forward. Here, the questions are as follows:
[[Kris|KRIS]]'S LAST NAME!? (Answer: DREEMURR)
WHAT WAS YOUR RANK ON [[TV Time#Round 1|BOARD 1]]!? (Answer: The player's rank on the first round of [[TV Time]])

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#First Quiz Room

property.name: description
property.value: A video game puzzle in which [[Kris]] takes control. They must use a [[Lancer Controller]] to dig up spots marked with "X" until all spots have been dug out. They then must push the box that appears onto a pressure plate and use [[Ralsei]]'s character to transform into a box on top of the other. To get the [[Egg]], they must use [[Susie]]'s character to throw the box across the lake.

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Revive Mint Puzzle

property.name: description
property.value: The first of the Stealth Zones, in which the [[party]] must avoid being spotted by the searchlights that line the floor. If they are caught, they are sent back to the [[Goulden Sam]] cage. The party initially attempt to sneak by slowly, but when [[Susie]] suggests going faster, the party now moves at a much faster pace.

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#First Stealth Zone

property.name: description
property.value: Pressing the switch in this trash can unlocks the door to the next room.

property.name: description
property.value: The second Stealth Zone, split into two parts by an intersecting doorway. The party must avoid constantly-moving columns of searchlights. If they are caught, they are sent to the beginning of the room.

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Second Stealth Zone and Watercooler Room

property.name: description
property.value: A video game puzzle, in which [[Kris]] takes control. Kris must use [[Susie]]'s character to construct a bridge across the river. Pressing the switch at the end retracts the spikes.

properties.property:
The [[party]] is met with a pop quiz and must answer two questions to continue forward. Here, the questions can be any of the following:
WHICH NUMBER IS [BIGGER/SMALLER]? (Answer: whichever number is bigger or smaller) WHAT LETTER DOES [ABSORB/BANANA/APPLEBABABA/BANANABABABA] [BEGIN/END] WITH? (Answer: A or B depending on word and condition)
CHOOSE [A/B]! (Answer: A or B depending on request)

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Second Quiz Room

properties.property:
The [[party]] is met with a pop quiz and must answer two questions to continue forward. Here, the questions can be any of the following:
WHICH NUMBER IS [BIGGER/SMALLER]? (Answer: whichever number is bigger or smaller) WHAT LETTER DOES [ABSORB/BANANA/APPLEBABABA/BANANABABABA] [BEGIN/END] WITH? (Answer: A or B depending on word and condition)
CHOOSE [A/B]! (Answer: A or B depending on request)

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Second Quiz Room

properties.property:
The [[party]] is met with a pop quiz and must answer two questions to continue forward. Here, the questions can be any of the following:
WHICH NUMBER IS [BIGGER/SMALLER]? (Answer: whichever number is bigger or smaller) WHAT LETTER DOES [ABSORB/BANANA/APPLEBABABA/BANANABABABA] [BEGIN/END] WITH? (Answer: A or B depending on word and condition)
CHOOSE [A/B]! (Answer: A or B depending on request)

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Second Quiz Room

properties.property:
The [[party]] is met with a pop quiz and must answer two questions to continue forward. Here, the questions can be any of the following:
WHICH NUMBER IS [BIGGER/SMALLER]? (Answer: whichever number is bigger or smaller) WHAT LETTER DOES [ABSORB/BANANA/APPLEBABABA/BANANABABABA] [BEGIN/END] WITH? (Answer: A or B depending on word and condition)
CHOOSE [A/B]! (Answer: A or B depending on request)

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Second Quiz Room

property.name: description
property.value: The third and final Stealth Zone, stretching across a long hallway. The [[party]] must avoid the constantly-moving searchlights. While traveling across, [[Pippins]] and [[Shadowguy]]s begin following the party. If they are caught, they are transported to the beginning of the room, behind a [[Goulden Son]] cage.

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Third Stealth Zone

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] passes through a stationary searchlight, which summons a [[Zapper]] who does not capture them.

property.name: description
property.value: An optional Stealth Zone with a slow-moving searchlight. Passing into the searchlight summons a [[Zapper]], who asks if [[Kris]] is a cheater. If Kris admits they are a cheater, the Zapper asks where they are going. If Kris answers "Where I came from," the Zapper transports them to the previous room. If Kris answers "Nowhere," the Zapper transports them to an isolated area, which is part of the [[Egg]] sidequest.

property.name: description
property.value: The continuation of the [[TV World#Revive Mint Puzzle|Revive Mint Puzzle]]. If [[Kris]] had used [[Susie]]'s character to throw the block to the other side of the river, they can then push the block onto the pressure plate to reveal a bridge allowing passage across the lake. The switch on the other side unlocks the way forward.

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Nowhere

property.name: description
property.value: [[Kris]] must speak to the [[Bibliox]] through the video game screen and exhaust its dialogue. They then must walk into the next room and return to reveal a wardrobe. Opening the wardrobe reveals it is empty, but speaking to the Bibliox again reveals that the [[Trip Ticket]] has been in the [[inventory]] the whole time they were exploring. The Trip Ticket then appears in the inventory.

property.name: page
property.value: TV World#Nowhere

property.name: description
property.value: If found during [[Chapter 1]], Starwalker can be found here after defeating [[Rouxls Kaard]]. He claims that he was the "star" before appending "walker."

property.name: description
property.value: [[Lancer]] occupies a console. He explains his job to the [[party]], and he can take back any [[Lancer Controller]]s in their [[inventory]]. He turns to stone after reaching the [[Green Room]].

property.name: description
property.value: Describes the security system in the TV World. If spoken to again, they tell [[Kris]] that they should clean up the place.

property.name: description
property.value: Explains that on their first day, they were taken and sent here, and they lament that they have not met another of their kind. If the party gets caught in first Stealth Zone, they are transported to this cage.

property.name: description
property.value: Plays saxophone noises when spoken to.

property.name: description
property.value: If found during [[Chapter 1]], Starwalker appears here and expresses frustration at the state of the jails.

property.name: description
property.value: A silver-colored [[Goulden Sam]] cage. They explain that they are the only one of their kind, making them original.

property.name: page
property.value: Suilver Sam

property.name: description
property.value: Explains that this room is known as "Punishment Cage B." They claim that it is better than Cage A, but not by much.

property.name: description
property.value: Is standing guard and wathing for cheaters. If the [[party]] admits they are cheaters, the Zapper sends them to the Suilver Sam cage, which fails to keep them trapped. The Zapper then admits defeat.

property.name: description
property.value: If [[moss]] has been eaten with [[Susie]] in [[Chapter 2]], she notices some spinach in the haystack, which she and [[Kris]] eat together. If the [[Dealmaker]] is equipped, the narration when inspecting the haystack quotes a line from [[Spamton]]'s introductory dialogue.

property.name: description
property.value: Comments on the state of the [[Shadowguy]]s working at the video game consoles.

property.name: description
property.value: A serious variant of [[Trashy]], who refuses to come to [[Kris]]'s [[Castle Town]]. If any enemy is defeated violently, they admonish Kris.

property.name: page
property.value: Serious Trashy

property.name: description
property.value: Is seen admiring [[Serious Trashy]]'s serious vibes. Disappears if any [[Ribbick]] is defeated violently.

property.name: description
property.value: A miniature [[Goulden Sam]] cage. Transports the party to the other side of the hallway.

property.name: page
property.value: Goulden Son

property.name: description
property.value: A miniature [[Goulden Sam]] cage. Transports the party to the other side of the hallway.

property.name: page
property.value: Goulden Son

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Shuttah]] explains the state of the [[Dark World]] before [[Tenna]]'s arrival. They explain that those who did not sign Tenna's contract left and went somewhere else.

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Zapper]] that transports [[Kris]] out of the area back to where they came from.

property.name: description
property.value: A [[Bibliox]] occupying a console, who only speaks in incoherent mumblings.

property.name: description
property.value: [[Kris]] is presented with a choice to make the [[Goulden Sam]] and [[Suilver Sam]] love or hate each other. If many enemies are defeated violently, "Hate" is automatically chosen.

property.name: description
property.value: Starwalker appears here after walking past this point and returning, and only if he was found in [[Chapter 1]]. He declares that he will be the "Star Walker." using [[Tenna]]'s "STAR" speech graphic.

property.name: description
property.value: Plays saxophone noises when spoken to.

property.name: description
property.value: Asks for an autograph. If [[Kris]] responds "Sign," they faint in shock.

property.name: description
property.value: Snaps a picture of the [[party]] when spoken to.

property.name: description
property.value: Explains the ranking system based on the [[party]]'s performance in [[Tenna]]'s games. He also mentions a [[Green Room#S-Rank Changing Room|secret room]] that can be accessed by achieving S-Rank.

property.name: description
property.value: Lanino and Elnina explain that they will be the [[party]]'s boss encounter. When spoken to subsequent times, they provide random weather forecasts.

property.name: description
property.value: Asks [[Kris]] to talk to him in the [[Green Room]].

property.name: description
property.value: Asks the [[party]] how he can be [[Tenna]]'s second-in-command.

property.name: description
property.value: Asks the [[party]] if they are prepared. If they answer yes, he transports them to the game room, where they play the first round of [[TV Time]].

property.name: description
property.value: A Dust Pile. Can be destroyed when interacted with.

property.name: page
property.value: Dust Pile

property.name: description
property.value: A Dust Pile. Can be destroyed when interacted with.

property.name: page
property.value: Dust Pile

property.name: description
property.value: A Dust Pile. Can be destroyed when interacted with.

property.name: page
property.value: Dust Pile

property.name: description
property.value: A Dust Pile. Can be destroyed when interacted with.

property.name: page
property.value: Dust Pile

property.name: description
property.value: Shadowguys roaming the area engage the [[party]] in battle when approached.

property.name: description
property.value: Shadowguys drop from the ceiling and engage the [[party]] in battle when approached.

property.name: description
property.value: A Ribbick emerges from the tipped-over trash can, which chases after and attacks the [[party]].

property.name: description
property.value: Static encounter against the Watercooler. If the party attempts to leave this room, they are blocked off my more Watercoolers that gradually converge on them as they leave and re-enter.

property.name: description
property.value: A Ribbick emerges from the tipped-over trash can, which chases after and attacks the [[party]].

property.name: description
property.value: Boss battle against Rouxls Kaard.

property.name: page
property.value: Rouxls Kaard#Chapter 3_2

property.name: description
property.value: Zappers jump into the room and roam around, engaging the [[party]] in battle if approached.

property.name: description
property.value: Sells one [[TV Dinner]] for 300 [[Dark Dollar]]s and three TV Dinners for $800.

property.name: description
property.value: Explains that [[TV World]] takes [[POINT]]s as currency instead of [[Dark Dollar]]s. They offer to sell [[TV Dinner]]s for 250 Dark Dollars each.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] can pick up a Lancer Controller from this console.

property.name: page
property.value: Lancer Controller

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] can pick up a Lancer Controller from this console.

property.name: page
property.value: Lancer Controller

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] can pick up a Lancer Controller from this console.

property.name: page
property.value: Lancer Controller

property.name: description
property.value: Treasure chest containing a TV Dinner.

property.name: page
property.value: TV Dinner

property.name: description
property.value: Treasure chest containing a Revive Mint.

property.name: page
property.value: Revive Mint

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] can obtain a TV Slop from inside this trash can.

property.name: page
property.value: TV Slop

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] can obtain 10 POINTs from inside this trash can.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] can obtain 2 POINTs from inside this trash can.

property.name: description
property.value: Treasure chest containing a [[Watercooler]] as well as 500 POINTs. If the static Watercooler was not fought, the Watercooler in the chest attacks instead.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] can obtain 120 POINTs from inside this trash can

property.name: description
property.value: The [[party]] can obtain 50 POINTs from inside this trash can.

property.name: description
property.value: Treasure chest containing 300 POINTs.

property.name: description
property.value: A total of 34 POINTs can be collected from the ground and the small treasure chests in this area.

property.name: description
property.value: Treasure chest containing 1 POINT.

property.name: description
property.value: Treasure chest containing a Deluxe Dinner.

property.name: page
property.value: Deluxe Dinner

property.name: description
property.value: An unseen NPC behind the shower curtain. They react to how the [[party]] defeated the [[Watercooler]].

property.name: page
property.value: Curtain NPC

properties.property: SPARE enemies whose names become YELLOW! Use PACIFY on TIRED enemies whose names are BLUE! And... remember [[Susie]] and [[Ralsei]]'s S-Action and R-Action, too!

property.name: description
property.value: Warp Door in the TV World Entrance. Unlocks after reaching the [[Green Room]].

property.name: page
property.value: Warp Door

property.name: description
property.value: Warp Door in the Goulden Sam area. Unlocks after reaching the [[Green Room]].

property.name: page
property.value: Warp Door

property.name: description
property.value: SAVE Point in the TV World Entrance.

properties.property: You are greeted by yet another prisonlike location. You question why your adventures feature so many of these.

'''Shadowguy recruited:''' You hear a jazz concert only consisting of saxophones. You are filled with the power of everyone playing solo at once.
'''Shadowguy not recruited:''' It's a concert, but no one is here to play. You are filled with the power of a crowd cheering for noone.
'''Shadowguy LOST:''' It's a concert, but no one has shown up. You question if a concert can be a concert if no one is there.
The incense of hot snacks and spicy flavors assaults you. You are filled with the power of the primal invention of fire.
You hear the audience whispering in awe at your presence. You are filled with the power of undeserved fame.
